description: Smallest k such that circle x^2 + y^2 = k passes through exactly 4n integer points.
links: Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1432 (a(1433) exceeds 1000 digits).
formula: A000446(n) = min(a(2n-1), a(2n)) for n > 1.A124980(n) = min(a(2n-1), a(2n)).A016032(n) = min(2*a(2n-1), a(2n), a(2n+1)).A093195(n) = min(a(2n), a(2n+1)).a(n) is least term of A054994 with exactly n divisors. - Ray Chandler, Jan 05 2012.
mathematica: (* This program is not convenient to compute huge terms - A054994 is assumed to be computed with maxTerm = 10^16 *) a[n_] := Catch[ For[k = 1, k <= Length[A054994], k++, If[DivisorSigma[0, A054994[[k]]] == n, Throw[A054994[[k]]]]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 28}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Jan 21 2013, after _Ray Chandler_ *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
